markdown:
٨ في الشكل المقابل تكون نسبة الضغط عند المكبس الكبير إلى الضغط عند المكبس الصغير .........

( الساحل / القاهرة ٣٣ )

أ  $\frac{1}{2}$
ب  $\frac{1}{1}$
ج  $\frac{2}{1}$
د  لا يمكن تحديدها <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.355,t=0.065,r=0.930,b=0.188), with ID 90f72ab4-c26c-4961-9351-80a168a5c329 -->

Summary : This illustration shows a U-shaped hydraulic system with two pistons of different areas, demonstrating the principle of hydraulic force multiplication.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  • The system consists of two vertical cylinders connected at the base by a horizontal tube, forming a U-shape.
  • The left cylinder has a cross-sectional area labeled "2A" and contains a piston with an upward force labeled "F".
  • The right cylinder has a cross-sectional area labeled "A" and contains a piston with a downward force labeled "f".
  • Both cylinders are filled with a liquid, shown in blue, at the same level beneath the pistons.

Technical Details :
  • The left piston (area 2A) is larger than the right piston (area A).
  • The force F acts upward on the larger piston, while the force f acts downward on the smaller piston.
  • The pistons are depicted as brown disks fitting tightly in their respective cylinders.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The left cylinder is wider and shorter, while the right cylinder is narrower and taller.
  • The liquid level is continuous and equal in both arms of the U-tube, indicating equilibrium.
  • The pistons are positioned at the top of the liquid columns in each cylinder.

Analysis :
  • The illustration visually demonstrates Pascal's principle: a force applied to a smaller piston (area A, force f) is transmitted through the incompressible fluid to produce a larger force (F) on a larger piston (area 2A).
  • The system exemplifies how hydraulic machines can multiply force, with the ratio of forces proportional to the ratio of piston areas. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.076,t=0.058,r=0.315,b=0.187), with ID 0710cea6-3c17-4819-8961-6f5ea2cb4768 -->

Summary : This figure presents four candidate graphs, each illustrating a possible relationship between the displacement of a large hydraulic piston (y₂) and the displacement of a small piston (y₁), with both axes labeled and all graphs sharing the same scale.

multiple line plots:
Title & Axes :
  • No explicit title on the figure, but context from the question: "Which of the following graphs represents the relationship between the displacement of the large piston (y₂) and the displacement of the small piston (y₁) for a hydraulic press, given both are plotted on the same scale?"
  • X-axis labeled as y₁ (displacement of the small piston).
  • Y-axis labeled as y₂ (displacement of the large piston).
  • No tick labels or numeric scales shown; axes are drawn as arrows.
  • Four subplots, each labeled with an Arabic letter: (د), (ج), (ب), (ا) from left to right.

Data Points :
  • (د): Red curve, downward-sloping, concave upward (decreasing, nonlinear).
  • (ج): Red straight line, steep positive slope (increasing, linear).
  • (ب): Red straight line, moderate positive slope (increasing, linear).
  • (ا): Red straight line, shallow positive slope (increasing, linear).

Design Encodings :
  • All graphs use blue axes and a red curve or line.
  • Each subplot is labeled with a circled Arabic letter below the x-axis.
  • No gridlines, markers, or additional annotations.

Distribution & Trends :
  • (د): y₂ decreases rapidly as y₁ increases (inverse relationship).
  • (ج), (ب), (ا): All show direct proportionality, but with different slopes (steepest in ج, shallowest in ا).

Analysis :
  • The figure is designed to test understanding of the mathematical relationship between the displacements of two pistons in a hydraulic system, offering options for both inverse and direct proportionality, as well as different slopes for the direct cases.
  • Only (د) shows a nonlinear, inverse relationship; the others are linear with varying slopes.
  • The correct choice would depend on the physical law governing hydraulic pistons (usually inverse proportionality if area is constant and volume is conserved). <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.069,t=0.197,r=0.927,b=0.384), with ID d0152336-f481-4393-9f26-1d2490feccbd -->

١٠ إذا كانت النسبة بين قطري مكبسي المكبس الهيدروليكي هي $\frac{٥}{١}$، فإن نسبة الضغط عند المكبس الصغير إلى الضغط الناتج عند المكبس الكبير في حالة اتزان المكبسين في مستوى أفقي واحد هي ........

(أ) $\frac{١}{٥}$

(ب) $\frac{٥}{١}$

(ج) $\frac{١}{١}$

(د) $\frac{٢٥}{١}$

(سمود / الغربية ٢٣) <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.073,t=0.390,r=0.929,b=0.479), with ID c5b50590-f6ec-4b02-b200-953cd00d3138 -->

١١ إذا كانت النسبة بين نصفى قطرى أسطوانتى المكبس الهيدروليكى  $\frac{5}{2}$ ، فإن الفائدة الآلية للمكبس تساوى ........

(أ) $\frac{5}{2}$    (ب) $\frac{25}{4}$    (ج) $\frac{2}{5}$    (د) $\frac{4}{25}$

(كفر الدوار / البحيرة ٢٤) <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.075,t=0.483,r=0.928,b=0.552), with ID cffe265c-29f9-4953-99ec-83d6a5b7b2f9 -->

١٢ إذا كانت الفائدة الآلية لكبس هيدروليكي تساوي ٢٥٠ ومساحة المكبس الصغير ٢.٥ cm² فإن نصف قطر المكبس الكبير يساوي ........

١٤.١ cm ⓘ      ١٠٠ cm ⓞ      ١٩٨.٨١ cm ⓞ      ٦٢٥ cm ⓞ

(أزمنت / الأقصر ٢٤) <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.072,t=0.555,r=0.929,b=0.639), with ID 9b26786a-45e0-4bb2-9d5d-a1759eb12918 -->

Summary : This is a physics illustration showing a hydraulic press system with two pistons of different areas, a liquid of density ρ, and a mass m placed on the larger piston. The diagram is accompanied by a multiple-choice question in Arabic, asking for the value of the mass m in terms of ρ, h, and A.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  • The diagram shows a U-shaped hydraulic press filled with liquid.
  • The left side has a small piston with area A and a height difference h above the liquid.
  • The right side has a larger piston with area 3A, on which a mass m is placed.
  • The liquid level is higher on the left side by a vertical distance h.
  • The system is labeled with variables: h (height difference), y (reference level), m (mass), A (area), 3A (area).
  • The system is at equilibrium.

Technical Details :
  • The liquid has density ρ.
  • The pistons are labeled with their respective areas: A (left), 3A (right).
  • The mass m is placed on the larger piston (right).
  • The height difference between the two liquid surfaces is h.

Accompanying Question and Choices :
  • The question asks: "A hydraulic press contains a liquid of density ρ and its pistons are at equilibrium as shown, with areas A and 3A. If the mass m is placed on the larger piston, what is the value of m?"
  • Four answer choices are given:
    - m = ρhA
    - m = 2ρhA
    - m = 3ρhA
    - m = 4ρhA

Analysis :
  • The illustration visually represents the principle of hydraulic equilibrium, where the pressure difference due to the height h of the liquid column is balanced by the force from the mass m on the larger piston.
  • The question tests understanding of pressure transmission in fluids and the relationship between force, area, and pressure in a hydraulic system.
  • All relevant variables (ρ, h, A, m) are clearly labeled, and the multiple-choice format provides possible algebraic expressions for m. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.073,t=0.644,r=0.927,b=0.780), with ID 4b108c5d-4131-4ae4-b02b-d8e44aa7c91e -->

Summary : This is a labeled illustration of a hydraulic press system with two pistons of different cross-sectional areas, accompanied by a physics problem in Arabic about the relationship between the masses placed on each piston for equilibrium, and four multiple-choice answers.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  • The diagram shows a U-shaped container filled with hydraulic fluid.
  • On the left side, a small piston labeled "m" with a small cross-sectional area "a" is placed.
  • On the right side, a larger piston labeled "M" with a larger cross-sectional area "10a" is placed.
  • Both pistons are shown pressing down on the fluid, and the fluid level is the same on both sides, indicating equilibrium.
  • The fluid is labeled "سائل هيدروليكي" (hydraulic fluid).

Technical Details :
  • The left piston is labeled with mass "m" and area "a".
  • The right piston is labeled with mass "M" and area "10a".
  • The system is described as being in equilibrium, neglecting the mass of the pistons themselves.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The two pistons are at the same horizontal level.
  • The U-tube is symmetric, with the left side narrower than the right.

Accompanying Problem Statement :
  • The text describes the system and asks: "If the small piston has area a and mass m, and the large piston has area 10a and mass M, and the system is in equilibrium at the same horizontal level (neglecting the mass of the pistons), then M = ?"
  • Four answer choices are provided:
    - (أ) M = m
    - (ب) M = 10 m
    - (ج) M = 100 m
    - (د) M = 150 m

Analysis :
  • The illustration visually supports a physics question about hydraulic equilibrium and Pascal's principle.
  • The key visual message is the proportional relationship between piston area and the mass required for equilibrium.
  • The answer choices suggest the problem is about determining the correct mass ratio for equilibrium, given the area ratio. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.080,t=0.784,r=0.923,b=0.928), with ID a85f872e-2b2f-45a5-aad3-a5bfc3b25ea7 -->
